title: Grapevine Core/Q&A Standup
content:
Meeting: Grapevine Core/Q&A Standup
Type: Scheduled
Started: 2025-12-01T16:57:12.084+00:00
Ended: 2025-12-01T17:33:48.418+00:00

Participants:
  - David Orr (david@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T16:57:14.257+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:22.550+00:00
  - vic (human) (victor@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:19.583+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:23.950+00:00
  - JohnnyD (jdallas@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:26.165+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:20.949+00:00
  - Jordan (jordan@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:34.742+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:21.728+00:00
  - Recording () joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:31.893+00:00
  - Kumail (kumail@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:57.061+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:25.196+00:00
  - Chandler (croth@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:18.999+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:21.096+00:00
  - Brent (brent@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:01:40.884+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:21.087+00:00
  - Andy (alui@gather.town) joined at 2025-12-01T17:02:12.367+00:00, left at 2025-12-01T17:26:27.668+00:00


Meeting Memos:

Meeting Memo

Summary:
The meeting focused on infrastructure cost reductions, reliability clean-ups, and progress on two product initiatives before next week’s New York off-site. Jordan confirmed tenant-pruning code will be in staging within the hour and reported that monthly cloud spend has fallen from roughly $60 k to about $25 k, with OpenSearch now the largest remaining expense. Chandler agreed to scrub noisy alert spam as an on-call task this week to restore signal quality. The Grapevine Reviewer and Verification/Intent loops remain top priorities; teams will keep iterating and aim for minimal viable versions by week’s end. Exponent’s ambient extraction is live again in staging, prompting follow-ups on Linear ticket labeling and Cursor credit usage, while Johnny will meet an OpenAI rep today to discuss credits amid shifting usage patterns. Unresolved items include further cost optimization opportunities and ensuring adequate ticket quality for downstream automation.

Notes:

Cost & Tenant Maintenance:
  - Tenant-pruning cron tested via CLI; Jordan will ship to staging and merge today, with logging and multi-day dry-run.
  - Cloud spend cut from ~$60 k to ~$25 k after buffer and embedding fixes; OpenSearch still ~$6 k/month.
  - Jordan to rerun full-day cost numbers tomorrow for accurate baseline.
  - Long-term levers: batch embedding API, potential OpenSearch replacement.

Alert Noise / Reliability:
  - Alerts Slack channel flooded with non-actionable messages.
  - Vic proposes treating clean-up as regular on-call hygiene.
  - Chandler will tackle it this week (estimated 1–2 h).

Grapevine Reviewer Workstream:
  - Dave refining per-category reviewer; currently flags too many valid issues.
  - Andy working on dedupe/denoise; Vic on false-positive reduction.
  - Team will sync again this afternoon; objective remains useful signal with fewer distracting comments.

Verification & Intent Loops:
  - Goal: ‘any-percent’ working loop by Friday, prior to NY off-site.
  - Codex agent CLI struggled; browser workflow better but Playwright retries inefficient.
  - 8 k-character limit in Cursor prompts noted; formatting quirks acceptable for now.

Exponent Ambient Extraction:
  - Feature re-enabled in staging; harvesting stand-ups, Slack messages, and PRs into Linear boards.
  - Some Linear tickets originate from TriageBot; need labeling to distinguish sources and curb Cursor credit spend.
  - Kumail confirms no prompt changes yet; purely ported functionality.

OpenAI Usage & Relationship:
  - Project ‘current’ responsible for ~⅓ of November OpenAI token spend; investigation ongoing.
  - Johnny meeting new OpenAI rep later today to explore credits and best-practice guidance.
  - Team expects to have sufficient usage to justify credits despite recent cost cuts.

Upcoming NY Off-site:
  - Most attendees confirmed; Andy and Jordan cannot attend.
  - Dave may miss due to potential jury duty (murder trial).

Action Items:
  - description='Merge tenant-pruning cron job to staging with logging and dry-run, then deploy' due_date=None assignee='Jordan'
  - description='Rerun and share updated cost numbers after a full day of real usage' due_date=None assignee='Jordan'
  - description='Scrub noisy alerts in Slack to restore actionable signal' due_date=None assignee='Chandler'
  - description='Meet with OpenAI representative to discuss credits and usage optimization' due_date=None assignee='JohnnyD'
  - description='Send Johnny an example Linear issue generated by ambient extraction' due_date=None assignee='Kumail'
  - description='(maybe?) Add label or other marker to distinguish TriageBot tickets from ambient extraction to reduce unnecessary Cursor cloud spend' due_date=None assignee='Kumail'

Transcript:

  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): All right, I think we can get going.
  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): How's everyone's Thanksgiving?

  - 77d6111f-11e6-4b89-835a-b948e4ed0f55|David Orr: Yeah, I can't have that. I just saw my wife's family, which was very nice, no complaints.
  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): We went to one national park. We spent a few days in Yosemite. That was good.
  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): Never been there so late in the season, though. It was, like, kind of icy.

  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): Or not Everyone. Some people brought crampons. We didn't, but it was kind of fun still. But yeah.

  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): Like the cost stuff and then core tenant cleanup. I think Jordan posted a bunch of stuff on cost in the channel, but just wanted to see if there was any more high level to give.

I think other things we can optimize later on down the line if we want to, but the way I see it is, like, the main reason we want to do this is just to get a handle on, to try to get closer to a reasonable level and also just get a handle on where the cost is coming from, which I think we kind of have now.
  - c93c652f-61b8-463e-9a39-02785815cc88|vic (human): There's also some, like, there's also some long term things that we've always said we could or should do if we got to a point where cost actually mattered more. Stuff like the batch embedding, API, stuff like potentially like moving off of Open Search entirely, that kind of thing. So we have a lot of options.
